text:
Pretty good Tze Char dish in South Buona Vista area. A lot of varieties on the menu that you can choose. What we have ordered were Salted Egg Pork Ribs, Hotplate Tofu with Seafood, Stir Fried Chicken with Black Bean Sauce, Fried Chicken Sliced with Salt and Pepper, Steamed Egg with Minced Meat, Sambal Sweet Potato Leaves.
Service was efficient, food came quickly not long after we ordered. Price were reasonable, decent portion, presentation quite good, and the taste was nice too. Recommended.

This is a great spot for Tze Char dishes in the South Buona Vista area. The menu offers a wide variety of options, so there's something for everyone. We ordered the Hor Fun with egg and the Fried Rice with egg, both of which were delicious.

The service was efficient; our food arrived promptly not long after placing our order. The prices are reasonable, and the portions are generous, making it great value for money.

The taste was satisfyingâ€” the Hor Fun had a smooth, silky texture with a savory, rich gravy, and the Fried Rice was fragrant with a nice. Highly recommended!

Ventured further out for lunch after church service today. Ordered the famous moonlight hor fun, prawn paste chicken, marmite ribs and other food...
The recommended dishes were awesome, especially the moonlight hor fun.
The venue is non air-conditioned and under the sweltering heat of the afternoon sun, be prepared to perspire. Yet this is well worth the food and nothing that an iced drink cannot solve.
Revisited after a long absence of 5 years. Ordered the fried bee hoon. It was pretty ordinary to the point of being forgettable.
A traditional coffeeshop set up without aircon . Price is nice and price is reasonable. Parking has limited space . Need to walk about 10 mins for next parking place
